item.title: renee add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "All good books are alike in that they are truer than if they had really happened and after you are finished reading one you will feel that all that happened to you and afterwards it all belongs to you: the good and the bad, the ecstasy, the remorse and sorrow, the people and the places and how the weather was. If you can get so that you can give that to people, then you are a writer." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: renee add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "All we have to decide is what to do with the time that is given us." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: renee add a quote by Isaac Asimov
item.description: "Never let your sense of morals prevent you from doing what is right." -- Isaac Asimov

item.title: renee add a quote by George Santayana
item.description: "Sanity is a madness put to good uses." -- George Santayana

item.title: renee add a quote by Kahlil Gibran
item.description: "You talk when you cease to be at peace with your thoughts." -- Kahlil Gibran

item.title: renee add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Memories warm you up from the inside. But they also tear you apart." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: renee add a quote by Edgar Allan Poe
item.description: "I have great faith in fools - self-confidence my friends will call it." -- Edgar Allan Poe

item.title: renee add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Lock up your libraries if you like; but there is no gate, no lock, no bolt that you can set upon the freedom of my mind." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: renee add a quote by Khaled Hosseini
item.description: "But better to get hurt by the truth than comforted with a lie." -- Khaled Hosseini

item.title: renee add a quote by Honoré de Balzac
item.description: "All happiness depends on courage and work." -- Honoré de Balzac

item.title: renee add a quote by Hal Borland
item.description: "No winter lasts forever; no spring skips its turn." -- Hal Borland

item.title: renee add a quote by Billy Collins
item.description: "You will always be the bread and the knife, not to mention the crystal goblet and—somehow—the wine." -- Billy Collins

item.title: renee add a quote by Cynthia Ozick
item.description: "We often take for granted the very things that most deserve our gratitude." -- Cynthia Ozick

item.title: renee add a quote by Edgar Allan Poe
item.description: "All that we see or seem is but a dream within a dream." -- Edgar Allan Poe

item.title: renee add a quote by John Boyne
item.description: "There's things that happen in a person's life that are so scorched in the memory and burned into the heart that there's no forgetting them." -- John Boyne

item.title: renee add a quote by Niccolò Machiavelli
item.description: "Everyone sees what you appear to be, few experience what you really are." -- Niccolò Machiavelli

item.title: renee add a quote by Norman Mailer
item.description: "Writing books is the closest men ever come to childbearing." -- Norman Mailer

item.title: renee add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "There ain't no sin and there ain't no virtue. There's just stuff people do." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: renee add a quote by Mona Van Duyn
item.description: "The world's perverse, but it could be worse." -- Mona Van Duyn

item.title: renee add a quote by Katharine Hepburn
item.description: "If you obey all of the rules, you miss all of the fun." -- Katharine Hepburn

item.title: renee add a quote by Alexander Pope
item.description: "Fools rush in where angels fear to tread." -- Alexander Pope

item.title: renee add a quote by Bram Stoker
item.description: "Listen to them, the children of the night. What music they make!" -- Bram Stoker

item.title: renee add a quote by Katharine Graham
item.description: "The longer I live, the more I observe that carrying around anger is the most debilitating to the person who bears it." -- Katharine Graham

item.title: renee add a quote by Scott Meyer
item.description: "Hypocrisy is the resin that holds the plywood of society together." -- Scott Meyer

item.title: renee add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "Either write something worth reading or do something worth writing." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: renee add a quote by Margaret Mitchell
item.description: "With enough courage, you can do without a reputation." -- Margaret Mitchell

item.title: renee add a quote by Herman Hesse
item.description: "Learn what is to be taken seriously and laugh at the rest." -- Herman Hesse

item.title: renee add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "You see things; you say, 'Why?' But I dream things that never were; and I say 'Why not?" -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: renee add a quote by Donald E. Westlake
item.description: "Nobody gets everything in this life. You decide your priorities and you make your choices. I'd decided long ago that any cake I had would be eaten." -- Donald E. Westlake

item.title: renee add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Books are for people who wish they were somewhere else." -- Mark Twain
